title: Amsterdam typography?
content:
Going to be in Amsterdam on business in a few weeks and I'm interested in any typographic book dealers, libraries with typographic resources, and stores with a good selection of bow ties and / or socks. Do you have bow ties in Europe? I don't recall seeing any except in England now that I think about it. Typographic bow ties would be nice, but I'm not holding my breath. I've got a few typographic socks and definitely want more.

I'm interested in type specimens, especially any san serif stuff. Any pointers to libraries would be appreciated.

George  
I was sad because I had no shoes, until I met a man who had no Bodoni.
author: gthompson

comments.content: George, be sure to visit [Nijhof & Lee](http://web.archive.org/web/20110518142232/http:/www.nijhoflee.nl/). They generally have the best selection of typography and design related books. Be sure to ask to see the used and antiquarian stock, which they keep upstairs.

_George, be sure to visit Nijhof & Lee. They generally have the best selection of typography and design related books. Be sure to ask to see the used and antiquarian stock, which they keep upstairs._

Thanks, John. I've been trolling lists of antiquarian dealers and not finding anything -- most appear to be in Utrecht -- so I missed Nijhof & Lee. So far they're all I've got on my list though.

George
